para.text: Source Export to Revizto
General Procedure
In general, all supported source files are exported to Revizto according to a standard 4-step procedure implemented via the Revizto plugin. Particularities of specific sources are described below.
Important
only supports 3D objects, so if your source project contains any lines these will not be exported. Make sure that your export view uses 3D objects.

li.text: Open the view you want to use for export in the source program. Note that Revizto export operates under the “you see is what you get” principle, so the final Revizto view will be based on what you choose in the source program.
Choose whether to create a new project or link files to an existing one. Note that you can link one source to multiple projects.
For an existing project, choose whether to overwrite existing files or to append new files to them. Files are appended on the basis of shared coordinates. For a new project, enter project name.

Define export options (differ for each source program). This is the most important step where accuracy is required. Most part of export errors and problems are caused by misinput at this stage and/or incorrect selection of the exported view (step 1). Most frequent problems and particularities of each source program are covered below.

para.text: Export and further Revizto model generation is based on source elements: viewpoints, materials, levels, phases (the exact list depends on the source software).

li.text: Launch export. When export completes, Revizto starts automatically (unless already running) and displays the result.

para.text: Note that, if you created a new project, you will have to define sharing options for it and manually upload it for the first time (if shared).
Relinking Projects
You can link one source to multiple Revizto projects. To relink your source, click the
Link Settings
button of the Revizto plugin. It initiates the dialog which allows you either to create a new project or to link your file to an existing one (i.e. to change the link).

para.text: Export Scheduler Application

The Export Scheduler Application displays all active export schedules. It can only be used when at least one schedule is created from a Revizto plug-in. Existing schedules are listed in the application with the source file and target Revizto project names indicated.
You can use the Export Scheduler to:

para.text: Note that even if two sources are scheduled to be exported at the same time, they are not exported simultaneously, but in turns.
When export time comes, the application launches and displays the progress and statuses.
